subject: Re: [junit] Displaying the results of parameterized JUnit 4 tests in Eclipse
msgSnippet: Bekesi, 1) This is a frequently requested feature, and I support it, although we ve not gotten it into the source tree yet.  Let me know if the proposal at
messageBody:
Bekesi,

1) This is a frequently requested feature, and I support it, although
we've not gotten it into the source tree yet. Let me know if the
proposal at

http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1647993&group_id=15278&atid=365278

Would meet your needs.

2) I'll respond to this separately.

David Saff

On 7/24/07, Békési Tibor <bekesi2002@...> wrote:
> Hi All,
>
> I am developing parameterized JUnit tests in Eclipse.
> The parameter sets are stored in a central database.
> I execute the tests using the default JUnit runner of Eclipse that
> displays something like below in the JUnit view (after a test run):
>
> ParamTest [Runner: JUnit 4]
> - [0]
> - testMethod[0]
> - [1]
> - testMethod[1]
>
> By default only an index is shown in brackets /[0]/ to identify the
> parameter set.
>
> 1.) Do you know any solution to display somehow the used parameters
> corresponding to a certain test execution?
>
> For example, it would be nice to see the following picture instead:
>
> ParamTest [Runner: JUnit 4]
> - [0]
> - testMethod[0](input=5, expect=25)
> - [1]
> - testMethod[1](input=2, expect=4)
>
> 2.) Is there a way to display the Standard Output/Error separately
> per each test run?
>
> Please write me if I am asking something that you usually handle with
> a completely different approach.
>
> Best regards,
> Tibor
>
>
>
>
>
